meanings.definition: Characterized by or exposed to strong winds.
meanings.sent1: The kite flew high in the windy sky.
meanings.sent2: It was a windy day, so we had to hold onto our hats.
meanings.sent3: The windy weather made the trees dance in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The windy conditions at the beach made it perfect for kite surfing.
meanings.sent5: The windy mountaintop offered a breathtaking view of the valley below.

meanings.definition: Full of or marked by wind.
meanings.sent1: The windy road twisted and turned through the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The sailboat glided smoothly on the windy lake.
meanings.sent3: The windy plains stretched out as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent4: The windy night whispered secrets through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The windy city skyline sparkled in the evening light.

meanings.sent1: Grandpa let out a loud windy during dinner.
meanings.sent2: The room filled with an unpleasant smell after someone passed windy.
meanings.sent3: The windy at the family gathering caused much laughter and teasing.
meanings.sent4: The dog looked guilty after a windy slipped out in the room.
meanings.sent5: The windy at the office meeting was blamed on the spicy lunch.
